intro: Scleria sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-headed sedge, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and distinctive, spherical seed heads that give it its common name. Scleria sphaerocarpa typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
